intro: Eurybia rudis var. arguta, commonly known as the rough stonecrop, is a perennial flowering plant native to the northern regions of North America. It belongs to the family Crassulaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that are often covered in a powdery coating. The plant produces clusters of small, star-shaped flowers in shades of white, pink, or purple, typically blooming in late summer. It thrives in rocky or well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or arctic environments. Due to its hardy nature, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
